Sentence.sentence: At the moment candidates are selected on a fairly narrow set of criteria such as prior academic and career performance, and analytical and problem solving abilities.

Sentence.sentence: From a political perspective, we need to understand the terms on which major countries like China and the USA might sign up to a global agreement because at the moment we don't have that consensus.

Sentence.sentence: I was hoping I could have a moment of your time if you're not too busy.

Sentence.sentence: It may not seem that way at the moment.

Sentence.sentence: It's funny you ask that because I never have this moment when I feel, "Ah, I've finished!" I watch footballers at the end of the match, you know, the whistle goes and they've won or lost.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"瞬间，片刻"之意。
means: moment较minute所表示的时间短，指一刹那或一段很短时间。有时也含持续的意味。
minute ： 指极短的时间，但可觉察到时间的持续。
instant常与moment换用，指一瞬间，但更侧重时间短促，多用于表示紧迫、瞬变等情况。

example.en: My big moment is not exactly a good looker, but he is pleasant enough.
example.zh: 我的心上人尽管其貌不扬，但是他相当讨人喜欢。

Sentence.sentence: Value the present moment and remember how fortunate you are to be alive.

jx.jx_en_mean: a time when a person or thing is tested, a decision has to be made, or a crisis has to be faced
jx.jx_cn_mean: 严峻考验时刻；紧要关头
当前流行（或出名、重要）的

jx.jx_en_mean: a request for someone to wait for a short period of time, especially to allow the speaker to do or say something

entry.def: You can refer to a very short period of time, for example a few seconds, as a moment or moments .

example.ex: In a moment he was gone...
She stared at him a moment, then turned away...
example.tran: 她凝视他片刻，然后转过脸去。

entry.def: A particular moment is the point in time at which something happens.

example.ex: At this moment a car stopped at the house...
example.tran: 就在这时，一辆轿车在房前停下了。

example.ex: Many people still remember the moment when they heard that President Kennedy had been assassinated.
example.tran: 很多人仍然记得听到肯尼迪总统遇刺的那一刻。

entry.def: If you say that something will or may happen at any moment or any moment now, you are emphasizing that it is likely to happen very soon.

example.ex: They ran the risk of being shot at any moment...
example.tran: 他们冒着随时会中弹的危险。

example.ex: He'll be here to see you any moment now.
example.tran: 他马上就会来这儿看你。

entry.def: You use expressions such as at the moment ,at this moment, and at the present moment to indicate that a particular situation exists at the time when you are speaking.

example.ex: At the moment, no one is talking to me...
This is being planned at the present moment...
example.tran: 目前这件事正在计划中。

entry.def: If you say that you do not believe for a moment or for one moment that something is true, you are emphasizing that you do not believe that it could possibly be true.

example.ex: I don't for a moment think there'll be a divorce.
example.tran: 我从来没想过将来会离婚。

entry.def: You use for the moment to indicate that something is true now, even if it will not be true in the future.

example.ex: For the moment, however, the government is happy to live with it.
example.tran: 不过目前政府对此还乐于容忍。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something has their moments, you are indicating that there are times when they are successful or interesting, but that this does not happen very often.
entry.tran: 有成功(或得意)的时刻；有吸引人的时刻

example.tran: 这部电影有其吸引人之处。

example.ex: He's not the thoroughly outgoing character you'd predict, although he has his moments.
example.tran: 虽然他也有活泼的时候，但他并非如你所想的那么外向。

entry.def: If someone does something at the last moment, they do it at the latest time possible.

example.ex: They changed their minds at the last moment and refused to go.
example.tran: 他们在最后一刻改变主意，决定不去了。

entry.def: You use the expression the next moment, or expressions such as 'one moment he was there, the next he was gone', to emphasize that something happens suddenly, especially when it is very different from what was happening before.
entry.tran: 下一刻，一会儿，紧接着（尤指突然发生很大变化）

example.ex: The next moment there was an almighty crash...
example.tran: 接着发生了剧烈的撞击。

example.ex: He is unpredictable, weeping one moment, laughing the next.
example.tran: 他喜怒无常，一会儿哭，一会儿笑。

entry.def: You use of the moment to describe someone or something that is or was especially popular at a particular time, especially when you want to suggest that their popularity is unlikely to last long or did not last long.

example.ex: He's the man of the moment, isn't he?
He calls it a 'contraption', using his favourite word of the moment.
example.tran: 他用了眼下他最喜欢说的“玩意儿”一词来称呼它。

entry.def: If you say that something happens the moment something else happens, you are emphasizing that it happens immediately after the other thing.

example.ex: The moment I closed my eyes, I fell asleep.

sentences.sentence: "the moment he arrived the party began"
"the disappointments of the here and now"
"decisions of great consequence are made by the president himself"
"virtue is of more moment that security"

means.word_mean: 5. the moment of a couple is the product of its force and the distance between its opposing forces
6. the n-th moment of a distribution is the expected value of the n-th power of the deviations from a fixed value

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin momentum (see momentum)

sentences.cn: 千头万绪, 摆在眼前最紧要的工作是什么 呢 ?
sentences.en: Thousands of strands loose ends, place in at the moment what is the most critical work?

sentences.cn: 在紧要关头, 你首先必须弄清楚事情的轻重缓急,孰先孰后.
sentences.en: Facing a critical moment, you should make clear the priorities first.

sentences.cn: 虽然洋基没被记上任何失误, 但是他们在紧要关头发生了好几次守备上的问题.
sentences.en: Although the Yankeess were charged with no errors, they had several fielding problems at critical moments.

sentences.cn: 总统今晚将就最紧要的问题向全国发表讲话.
sentences.en: The President will speak to the nation tonight on a matter of the greatest moment.

sentences.cn: 对于那些对学生来说无关紧要的释义,你无妨略而不谈.
sentences.en: You can pass over the meanings which are of no moment to the student.

sentences.cn: 但是对于南诏王来说当前最紧要的问题是巩固自己的统治.
sentences.en: And the most pressing matter of the moment was to strengthen his governance.

sentences.cn: 英国将到紧要关头.
sentences.en: The moment of truth is approaching for Britain.

sentences.cn: 历史和地理因素共同将希腊推至作出抉择的紧要关头。
sentences.en: History and geography have conspired to bring Greece to a moment of decision.

sentences.cn: 人生中，步步相随。无论好与坏，每一天都一样的重要。人生中没有一个时刻是无关紧要的。
sentences.en: In life, one step creates the next. Each day is of equal importance, no matter how good or bad. There is no moment in life that does not matter.
sentences.from: 金山词霸 每日一句

Sentence.sentence: It can be very hard to forget embarrassing moments, says Donohue.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: I remember sitting on a bench with my aunt at a yoga studio, she said, and having a moment of clarity right then and there: Yoga is saving my life.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Consider the current moment in your own life, your team or your organization.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As much as we would like to cling on to our past, even the saddest moments can be washed away with time.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In that moment of clarity Leah made an important leap, conquering her inner resistance to change and making a firm commitment to take bigger steps.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: When your elderly relative needs to enter some sort of long-term care facility—a moment few parents or children approach without fear—what you would like is to have everything made clear.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Even if there is no concrete benefit paid in response to your good deed, at the very least, the doer of the good deed has the opportunity to enjoy a kind of spiritually enlightened moment.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Yet moments like this one are just the kind of intense absorption and pleasure adults spend the rest of their lives seeking.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They tend to enjoy the moment when something good is happening, and seize opportunities that come up.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The traditional view of such moments is that they constitute a charming but irrelevant byproduct of youth— something to be pushed aside to make room for more important qualities, like perseverance ( ' ,  坚持不懈 ), obligation, and practicality.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Modern airplanes have two black boxes: a voice recorder, which tracks pilots' conversations,and a flight-data recorder, which monitors fuel levels, engine noises and other operating functions that help investigators reconstruct the aircraft's final moments.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Substitutions of one gesture for the other often create not only humorous but also embarrassing moment.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: And what's more, you use it every day, almost every moment of your life.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Um, anything else that strikes you at the moment?
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Actually, I'm on holiday with my family in Thailand at the moment, although I wish it were with my friends instead.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月四级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: At the moment, we're living much longer.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月四级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: In that moment of clarity Leah made an important leap, conquering her inner resistance to change and making a firm commitment to take bigger steps.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月四级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Now where are you working at the moment?
Sentence.come: 2015年12月四级真题（第二套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Take-homes require thoughtful engagement which can lead to longer term stress as there is never a moment when the time is up?
Sentence.come: 2017年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B
